body.p: SECOND PUBLIC CONCERT SUNDAY The second of a series of public concerts was held at the high school auditorium starting at 3 o’clock Sun- 1 day afternoon and was attended by a large and appreciative audience. The concert consisted of a varied musical program from different high ‘ school organizations under the direc- ' tion of Miss Verna Keefe and Jay R. Jorgenson. A. H. Trask and son Hugh, Robert 1 Mills, John and David Noble, Ronald 1 Anderson and Bobby Squires went to 1 La Crosse last Saturday to attend a Boy Scout life saving contest held - there that day at the high school : building. Scouts from various dis- tricts wore in attendance. * Mrs. Will Onstad entered the hos- 1 pital Monday and was operated the next morning for the removal of a s goitre. She has been getting along 1 nicely since. Mrs. Onstad has not t been well for a long time, and her s friends hope that she may be much i better now. j Mrs. Gust Randles, who moved ; here from Merrill last year and has been living in an apartment in the ' Kelner home, entered the hospital on 1 Friday for medical treatment, as she - lias been quite poorly lately. She is i improving a little under treatment. * Application for a marriage license ! was made by Hugh Ellsworth Sharp. I son of Mr. and Mrs. Hugh Sharp, of 5 Disco, and Miss Gladys Almira Dan- ( ielson, daughter of Helmer Danielson, of Irving.
